docs.snippet: Ireland remained mired in political limbo Wednesday after lawmakers overwhelmingly rejected all three candidates to lead the country's next government....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ireland remained mired in political limbo Wednesday after lawmakers overwhelmingly rejected all three candidates to lead the country's next government.

headline.main: 40 Days in Limbo: Ireland Fails to Elect Leader for 2nd Time
headline.print_headline: 40 Days in Limbo: Ireland Fails to Elect Leader for 2nd Time

docs.snippet: A 78-year-old state senator is attempting to run out the clock on Nebraska's legislative session with a filibuster in which he has described getting a colonoscopy and quizzed a colleague about the best way to pour a beer....
docs.lead_paragraph: A 78-year-old state senator is attempting to run out the clock on Nebraska's legislative session with a filibuster in which he has described getting a colonoscopy and quizzed a colleague about the best way to pour a beer.

docs.snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron, his wife and their children will  not benefit in future from any offshore funds or trusts, a spokesman said on Wednesday as the British leader faced more questions over family tax affairs....
docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron, his wife and their children will  not benefit in future from any offshore funds or trusts, a spokesman said on Wednesday as the British leader faced more questions over family tax affairs.

headline.main: UK's Cameron Not Set to Benefit From Offshore Funds
headline.print_headline: UK's Cameron Not Set to Benefit From Offshore Funds

docs.snippet: Tackling extremism is a political minefield in Pakistan, where politicians openly consort with leaders of banned militant groups and sympathy exists within the security forces and civil administration for perpetrators of crimes committed in the na...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tackling extremism is a political minefield in Pakistan, where politicians openly consort with leaders of banned militant groups and sympathy exists within the security forces and civil administration for perpetrators of crimes committed in the name of religion. As a result, many remain skeptical of the state's ability to put an end to the militant violence that kills hundreds of Pakistani civilians each year.

headline.main: In Pakistan, Tackling Extremism Is a Political Minefield
headline.print_headline: In Pakistan, Tackling Extremism Is a Political Minefield
